page.title: 15Camping in Slindon Woods.
page.content: Just off Slindon Top Road, on the road to Eartham village, the Camping Club have a camp site which is set in the famous and beautiful Slindon Beech Woods. It is reported that it was near here that the future King Charles II paused to admire the view during his escape to France after the Battle of Worcester in the 17th century. Visitors to the camp site are free to explore the local woods and beauty spots, including Nore Folly (page 10 of this text) and Eartham Village (page 14 of this text). The camp site is a small, intimate camp, where back_ packers are welcomed. Its amenities are good, but visitors must be warned that the nearest bus stop is some two miles distant from the site!
